Package edu.bu.labs.stealth.graph

Class Path

java.lang.Object
edu.bu.labs.stealth.graph.Path
public class Path extends Object
A class to represent a path through the graph (from a source Vertex to a destination Vertex) produced from a Sepia game. A Path object is a node in a reversed linked-list. The tail of the linked list is a Path object that contains the source Vertex (and its parent is set to null). The head of the linked list is a Path object that contains the destination Vertex and the parent of the head is set to a Path object containing the Vertex before the destination in the path. There is an edge case where a path has not been expanded beyond the source Vertex. In this case the head and the tail of the linked-list are the same Path object. Here is an example to build a path from coordinate (0,1) to adjacent coordinate (1,1): Path p = new Path(new Vertex(0, 1)); // tail of the linked list p = new Path(new Vertex(1, 1), 1.0, p); // add edge (0, 1) -> (1, 1) with cost 1.0 to the head of the path.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Path

      public Path(Vertex dst)
      A constructor to create the tail of a Path object.
      Parameters:
      dst - The destination (and also source) of this path

    • Path

      public Path(Vertex dst, float edgeCost, Path parentPath)
      A constructor to create a Path object that represents an edge between the destination of another path to a new Vertex (including edge cost).
      Parameters:
      dst - The destination Vertex of the edge being added to the path
      edgeCost - The weight of the edge being added to the path
      parentPath - The rest of the path the edge is being added to. The destination of this Path object is the source Vertex of the edge being added

    • Path

      public Path(Vertex dst, float edgeCost, float newEstimatedPathCostToGoal, Path parentPath)
      A constructor to create a Path object that represents an edge between the destination of another path to a new Vertex (including edge cost). This constructor also, as a convenience for A* implementations, also will store the heuristic value evaluated on the new destination Vertex of this path.
      Parameters:
      dst - The destination Vertex of the edge being added to the path
      edgeCost - The weight of the edge being added to the path
      newEstimatedPathCostToGoal - The heuristic value of the new destination Vertex
      parentPath - The rest of the path the edge is being added to. The destination of this Path object is the source Vertex of the edge being added.

  • Method Details

    • getDestination

      public final Vertex getDestination()
      A getter method to get the destination Vertex of this Path object.
      Returns:
      The destination Vertex of this Path object

    • getTrueCost

      public float getTrueCost()
      A getter method to get the cost of the path from the source Vertex to the destination Vertex (i.e. the "observed" cost of this path).
      Returns:
      The cost of the path from the source Vertex to the destination Vertex.

    • getEstimatedPathCostToGoal

      public float getEstimatedPathCostToGoal()
      A getter method to get the estimated path cost from the destination Vertex to a goal vertex (i.e. the heuristic value of the destination Vertex of this path). This is useful for the A* algorithm.
      Returns:
      The estimated path cost from the destination Vertex to a goal vertex.

    • getParentPath

      public final Path getParentPath()
      A getter method to get the path up to the edge (not including) that leads to the destination Vertex of this Path object. If our path is v_dst <- u <- w <- ... <- src, then this method returns the path u <- w <- ... <- src.
      Returns:
      The rest of the path not including the destination nor the edge that ends at the destination Vertex of this Path object.

    • setEstimatedPathCostToGoal

      public void setEstimatedPathCostToGoal(float estimatedCost)
      A setter method to set the estimated path cost to the goal from the destination Vertex of this Path object (i.e. set the heuristic value of the destination Vertex of this Path object). Useful for the A* algorithm.
      Parameters:
      estimatedCost - The new heuristic value of the destination Vertex of this Path object.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      A method to convert a path into it's String representation. The String representation of a path is a sequence of the Vertex objects contained within the path. The string is prepended by the String "Path(" and the String ")" is added at the end. Since the Path class implements a path as a reversed linked-list, the vertices are also listed in the reverse order: the destination Vertex of the path is listed first and the source Vertex of the path is listed last.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The String representation of this Path object (which serves as the destination of a path)

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object other)
      A method to determine if Object other is equal to this Path object. An Object is equal to this Path if the object is also a Path object that shares the same destination Vertex. The entirety of the path is not considered to allow graph traversal algorithms to use Path objects in data structures and quickly infer whether the destination Vertex of the Path object has been discovered or not.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      other - The object to compare against this Path object
      Returns:
      true if this Path is equal to the object, and false otherwise.

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      A method to get the hashcode of this Path object. The hashcode of a Path object is defined as the hashcode of the destination Vertex contained within the Path object. This is done to allow graph traversal algorithms to put Path objects in hashing data structures yet infer based on the destination Vertex objects.
      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      The hashcode of this Path object.
